title: China launches Belt and Road foothold in Latin America
summary: State-owned enterprises announce first wave of infrastructure loans in the region.
impact: Establishes long-term financing leverage across critical logistics nodes.

title: Ecuador's Coca Codo Sinclair Dam construction begins
summary: Chinese firm Sinohydro undertakes Ecuador's largest energy project for $2.25 billion, demonstrating China's infrastructure reach.
impact: Demonstrates how debt leverage drives policy concessions and deepens Chinese influence in critical infrastructure.

title: Próspera launches on Roatán
summary: A public-private governance partnership establishes the first Strategic Economic Zone aligned with U.S. standards.
impact: Demonstrates alternative model for transparent, rules-based development that respects sovereignty.

title: Dominican Republic switches recognition to Beijing
summary: After 77 years of diplomatic relations with Taiwan, Dominican Republic establishes ties with PRC.
impact: Part of broader pattern of Chinese diplomatic pressure in the Caribbean and Central America.

title: Honduras switches recognition to Beijing
summary: Honduras becomes the latest Western Hemisphere nation to sever ties with Taiwan in favor of China.
impact: Leaves Paraguay as the last South American country maintaining diplomatic relations with Taiwan.

title: Peru's Chancay megaport inaugurated
summary: China's Cosco opens $3.6 billion strategic port with 60% ownership, transforming Pacific trade routes.
impact: Gives Beijing substantial control over South American maritime logistics and trade infrastructure.
